message.content:
I'll calculate each financial ratio step by step based on the provided financial statements.

## Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $9,963,057.95 / $829,755.77 = 12.01

## Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($2,610,115.02 / $5,695,115.02) × 100% = 45.83%

## Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $829,755.77 / $15,023,526.85 = 0.06

## Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = ($1,193,771.08 / $5,695,115.02) × 100% = 20.96%

## Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = ($3,730,866.78 + $3,938,781.80) / $829,755.77 = $7,669,648.58 / $829,755.77 = 9.24

## Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -$224,133.22 - $106,218.20 = -$330,351.42

## Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = ($1,193,771.08 / $15,023,526.85) × 100% = 7.95%

{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '12.01', 'Gross Profit Margin': '45.83%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.06', 'Net Profit Margin': '20.96%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '9.24', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-330351.42', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '7.95%'} }
